inn1.comm: what a start for Australia. Amla has leading-edged it back to Bollinger. Shaun George wants to check with a replay if Bollinger has overstepped. Replays show he is fine. Amla looks to play the shot that pays his bills, a flick off the pads, but he is a microsecond too early. Remember he himself said he expected a slow wicket. The leading edge is taken, and Bollinger accepts a dolly back
on target, short of a length, on off, defended to off
short of a length, around off, angling away a touch, defended to cover
fuller, pushed through, Kallis shoulders arms to it
wide outside off, Kallis doesn't go after it
Kallis breaks the maiden by tucking this around the corner on the leg side
starts with one angled across Kallis, who lets it be
length ball, just outside off, presses forward to defend it to cover
short of a length, outside off, shoulders arms to it
short, swift too, 145ks, Kallis is slightly hurried into the hook from chest high. Skiddy bounce there. He has used the pace really well, it's gone for a six into the wind, well square of long leg
short of a length, widish, pushed to cover-point
wide half-volley, leans into it, and drives it magnificently between mid-off and extra cover. Oh how easy Kallis makes them look
bouncer down the leg side, easy call of a wide

whoa, that kicks from just short of a length. Smith has to arch back to get out of the way. On second viewing it didn't look that dangerous, as it was widish and came only chest high. He stays out of the way, though
bunts this wide of pint to get off the mark
angling away, stays on the crease, and punches this square, to point
short, outside off, wristily defended back to the bowler
slower short ball, 127ks, outside off, Kallis looks to pull but it squeezes under his bat
lovely off-drive. This is hardly a half-volley, but he meets it with a straight bat, on the up, and sends it speeding between the bowler and mid-off
length ball, on off, flicked away to short midwicket
Smith's strong bottom hand sends this past short midwicket, from outside off
the pitch is a touch two-paced. This is short of a length, outside off, digs in the surface, moves away, beats the edge, falls in short of Haddin, and allows a bye
length ball, angling in, worked away for a single
accurate length ball, no room, pushed to leg
length ball, starts outside off, angles away, left alone
walks across to this, clips it off the pads, from outside off, for a single
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
short of a length, on off, flicked away to deep square leg
bouncer, 144.5ks, on off, chest high, pulls it, and keeps it down
short and wide, Kallis sits back and cuts the leather off it. Neither point nor third man has a chance
this is an even better shot. Gets a length ball on off, presses half-forward, closes the face late, providing the whip with the wrists, placing it wide of mid-on
starts with a length ball at 141k, Smith defends in front of off
slightly slower, slightly fuller, he drives in front of his body, but drives emphatically, between mid-off and extra cover
short of a length, around the hip area, 145ks, tucked away fine to short fine leg
there the bottom hand shows up, looks to drive this widish delivery, plays away from the body, and the face closes to mis-hit it back to Cummins
short of a length, on off, pushed to midwicket
lenght ball, outside off, pushes forward to defend with an open face
length, on the pads, takes the leading edge, towards mid-on
short of a length, outside off, runs it down for a single
short of a length, outside off, punched away square to point
here's a grubber outside off. Doesn't come up at all, from short of a length. Had this been stumps, Smith would have been making the walk back
half-volley, looks to muscle this down the ground, ends up hitting it back to Watson
length ball, on off, pushes forward, defends to cover
full delivery, on off, pushed back to Cummins
length ball, on off, push-driven to mid-off
slightly shorter, angling in towards off, Kallis is half-forward to defend
angling down the leg side, Kallis fails to make connection, but Haddin makes a superb acrobatic save to prevent four leg-byes. That's real good work, full length to his left, and behind his body
full, on off, driven to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, seems to hurry onto him, 145ks, defended square
length, angling in, pushed past short midwicket
length, wide outside off, plays with an open face, can't beat point
short of a length, hits the pad in front of leg, appeals for leg-before. Can't be out because this pitches well outside leg. They take the leg-bye
pitched up, outside off, Kallis presses forward and defends
length ball, outside off, holds its line, Kallis opens the face and takes a single
length ball, on leg, flicked away for a single past midwicket
played square on the off side, can't beat point
short of a length, speeds through, beats his attempt to run it down behind square. No feet
Smith opens the front leg early, and drives a length ball wide of mid-off for one
angling into the pads, deflected to the left of short fine. Doherty makes a diving save, but the ball hits the hand and ricochets to deep square to allow them the second
Kallis is having one of them days. Length ball, middle and leg, he lofts this over mid-on. Effortless, just goes through the line of the ball. Clears mid-on comfortably
full, swinging in late, near yorker, clipped away past square leg
overpitched on the pads, pushed to midwicket
too full again, pushed for an easy single to cover
overpitched, outside off, driven to long-on for one
length ball, angling into the pads, pushed to mid-on who is at the edge of the circle
short, stays low, but he punches it to long-on for one
full, on the stumps, drives to leg, but can't beat short midwicket
that's sharp, although the speed gun shows only 141ks. Pitches short of a length, beats him for pace, and hits the thigh pad
full, outside off, the bottom hand comes in, resulting in a thick inside edge for a couple square of long leg
wide outside off, not a half-volley, but he stretches forward, covers the line, and push-drives it with an open face, between mid-off and extra cover. No feet, but arms and hands do the job
tucked away off the hip, between long leg and deep square, comes back for two. The throw has to come into the wind, so it's an easy second

that is close to what Smith wants to do. Length ball, wide, with roo, he pushes forward, the foot gets close to the line of the ball, and then drives on the up. Between mid-off and extra cover. That's not bad for a predominantly leg-side player
slower ball, on off, angling away slightly, opens the face on it, can't beat point
full, middle and off, driven past Doherty for one
length ball, just outside off, stays back to dab it fine of short third for a single
slight drift with this one, but too full again. Pushed to short midwicket
looks to cut, but the ball stops at him, ends up hitting it to cover
beautiful shot as he takes this from outside leg to go inside-out, but Clarke makes a diving save at cover
driven down to long-on for one
full, on off, holds its line, gets an inside edge towards mid-on

huge shout for lbw, not given, and they have decided to not review it after a long deliberation. This did seem to hold its line so it could have been really close. It pitched on a length, hit Kallis in front, but the replays show only a quarter of the ball pitched inside the line of leg. That wouldn't have been reversed on the review
worked away off the pads for a single
tries the hook, early into it, gets a bottom edge onto the body
wristily hit off a length, but can't beat short midwicket
another whip from around off, and again finds short midwicket
turn now. Tossed up outside off, not overpitched, gives it time to turn, and that beats the edge
full again, defended back to the bowler
too full, Kallis opens up slightly and mercilessly sweeps this by the square leg umpire. Bisects the two deep men
pushed to sweeper-cover for one
pushed through, off and middle, stays back and defends
clipped away off the pads, retains strike
full, outside off, moves across and whips it past midwicket
clipped away off the pads

length ball, on off, driven to the right of mid-on, Smith almost runs into Johnson. He then moves away, but after completing the run he has a polite word and finger-pointing or two. The crowd loves it too
clipped away to deep midwicket for a single

Johnson has missed a relatively easy run-out. This hits the pads, doesn't go far, Kallis wants the single, Smith doesn't start. Belatedly he goes. Johnson has enough time to lob the ball back but he goes for a direct hit. It's a wild throw, doesn't even land on the pitch
driven to sweeper-cover for single. Amid all the chaos, Kallis serenely keeps scoring
length ball outside off, pushes with an open face, can't beat point
short of a length, doesn't come up, but he pulls it away to deep midwicket
short of a length, wide, runs this down to third man for one
runs this down off the face of the bat, gets a single to third man
length ball on the pads, closes the face to take a single to deep square
Kallis smoothly moves to another fifty, picking this off the hip, taking a single to deep square. His 100th score of 50 or more in ODIs
dabs it down to third man for another single
length ball, outside off, defended with an open face
full, on the pads, whipped away square of deep square leg, where our man Steve Smith makes a diving save
slower ball, cutting into the pads, checks the shot well, takes a single wide of midwicket
short of a length, on off, cuts away, squares him up, defended to cover
runs this one behind square for a single
this one kicks off a length, hits the seam and jumps, hits the top six inches of the bat, outside off, and runs to third man
that's some shot for somebody as bottom-handed as Smith. Jumps out of the crease, gives himself room, drives inside-out, between mid-off and extra cover
and dabs this square for a single
this is taken from inside Haddin's gloves, runs it fine to third man for another single
thick edge, Smith won't mind it. Watson hits the seam again, and there is extra bounce as Smith looks to cut. The edge flies fine, and Watson is down on his haunches. Century partnership up
fires in a wide outside leg
overpitched, on the pads, clipped away to deep midwicket
short of a length, on off, tries to run it fine, the slowness means he ends up hitting it to point
full, on the pads, flicked away square, Smith makes another diving save to save two runs here
full, on the pads, picked away for a single
short of a length, outside off, opens the face, takes the single
punched away to sweeper-cover for one
just short of a length, no room, Kallis again tries that third man single, but there is no room available
length on off, pushed to midwicket
flighted on off, guided into the leg side for a single
flighted, middle and leg, turns, hits the edge, wide of keeper
more turn, but this time Kallis has it under control, guiding it to point
quicker, fuller, down the leg, Kallis is quick to paddle it delicately, past the keeper, to the right of fine leg
tossed up outside off, closes the face on it, to midwicket
full toss outside off, driven to long-off
full and wide, holds its line, beats the outside edge. No feet here
jumps out, across, outside off, the ball is even wider, and beats the outside edge again
length ball outside off, crashes it to sweeper-cover to get to 50. He is feeling his way back to form, and the whole ground stands up and applauds. Smith takes time to acknowledge the support
slower ball, outside off, looks to run it down, but early into the dab, bottom-edging it
length ball, pushed to deepish mid-off for one
overpitched on off, pushed to cover
driven on the up, to extra cover

this has got nothing to do with the way the ball is bowled. Kallis seemed t have made his mind he would hit a six over midwicket this ball. And he does. Goes on a knee, sweeps in front of square, a fullish ball, goes for a parallel and big six
this is slightly shorter, and grips and turns, but the outside edge beats both keeper and short third man
defended to cover this time
closes the face on this to take a single to square leg
full and wide, driven straight to extra cover
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of short midwicket
that's his fourth boundary between mid-off and extra cover. This is an extraordinary innings from Smith. Leaves the crease, makes room, sends it crashing between the two men
this short ball chases him as he backs away, but he still manages a single to deep square
punched away square for a single, Haddin shouts in the background, "One wicket boys"
good yorker, 141ks, in front of off and middle, he digs it out well
more turn, this is flat too, pitches in front off and breaks away, beats the edge
even more turn, flat again, on off and middle, beats the drive, misses the off stump by inches. A slight puff of dust too
short of a length, on off, stays back to defend
paddled away from well outside off, moves away from the strike. It should be easier for Smith to face the left-arm spinner, who will bring the ball into him
swept away from well outside off, gets a single to long leg
full, on off, hit back to the bowler
beaten first ball. Smith is drawn out to play a really full delivery, misses it, but it goes between Haddin's legs. Nearly a yorker for him, so only a half chance for the stumping
tries the reverse sweep outside off, beaten
sweeps this square, all along the ground for one
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one

Smith reviews this, Steven that is. Graeme has once again tried that cute reverse-sweep, misses, Haddin and Steven go up immediately. Umpire says no. Smith reviews immediately. The replays suggest a tiny little noise noise as the ball passes the glove, but there is no visual confirmation in normal replays. The Hot Spot, though, confirms a touch on the glove, and off goes Graeme
flighted outside off, Duminy is well outside off to defend it to cover
full, on off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, pushed to cover

more misjudgement from South Africa. After G Smith's too-cute-by-half reverse-sweep, Kallis has run himself out trying a cute second. Tries the paddle sweep, the top edge clears the keeper, but has hardly crossed the 30-yard circle. Clarke from slip runs back and fields and hits the stumps direct. So far short is Kallis he might have been out had Haddin to collect and remove the bails
full, on the pads, defended to leg
forces this square on the off side, past point, gets a single
tossed up outside off, presses forward to block it back to the bowler
defended solidly off the front foot
defended to cover
flat, quick, no turn, hits the pad
charges at him and drives, Warner gets a bad bounce at cover
too full, hit back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, holds its line, left alone
defended to cover
angled into the pads, defended to leg
comes down the track, drives handsomely, can't beat cover
more turn for Xman, this is flat and quick, takes the edge, and goes between keeper and slip. Fortunate runs
nearly gets him again, slows this one down, Faff looks to play it to leg, gets a soft leading edge that goes nowhere
quick on off, defended to cover
clipped off the pads for a single
full, on the pads, flicked to midwicket
full, on the pad, clipped away for an easy single square on the on side
lovely googly, Duminy has no clue about it and pushes forward, but what seems an edge has come off the back pad
low full toss, swept away
turned around the corner for a single
quick, full, on the pads, defended
slower through the air, du Plessis comes down the track, right down to the pitch, drives it inside-out, and this time he also manages to beat cover
slower through the air, pushes forward and efends
flatter, quicker, pushed back to the bowler

he has walked past this one. This is superbly bowled. He jumps out of the crease again, Doherty gets a little bit of drift, a little of dip, which opens him up slightly. He is not close to the pitch now, and ends up feeling for the ball. It pitches one a length in front of leg, turns away, beats the bats and the stumps. Haddin does the rest
moves across to the first ball he faces, sees it's short, stays back, and pushes it into the on side for a single
Miller counterattacks. The second ball he faces. Comes down the track, right to the pitch of the ball, and smashes it for a parallel six over long-off
short on middle and leg, pulled away for one
short of a length, middle and leg, defended to leg

We have a mystery bowler on our hands. Duminy Haddin and Clarke, all beaten. Full ball, outside off, goes straight on. Duminy misses the sweep. Haddin misses the collection. Clarke doesn't have enough time to get to his right
leaves the crease with defence on his mind, pushing it back to Smith
this could be a googly, beats Duminy's toe end as he looks to cut
moves forward to defend this back to the bowler
waits for this to turn in, dabs it slightly wide of point for one
tossed up outside off, comes down the track and kicks it away
flatter, he stays back, and places it wide of point
length ball, on the pads, can't beat short fine leg

Shaun George's first big decision in ODIs has been challenged. He has given Miller lbw. This is angled away, pitching appreciably outside off, then turns against the angle, seems to me to have hit him outside the line. George has given it, though. Hot Spot deliberates over an inside edge even before we get to check the line of it. There is a faint small minuscule white mark on the inside edge. Shaun George stands corrected
short, outside off, punched down the ground for one
short of a length, on off, defended back to the bowler
he is pressing forward, Smith is keeping them just short of driving length. Defended back
this is short and wide, muscled to long-off for one
overpitched, on the pads, glanced away fine for a single
short, just outside off, cut away for a single
length ball, on off, pushed with soft hands, gets a single before extra cover can intervene
length ball, just outside off, hits the inside half of the bat
pushed straight to straight midwicket, sent back
slower short ball, doesn't bouncer high, Duminy knows nothing about it and stands and watches helplessly
full, outside off, driven to mid-off
quick length ball, 144ks, no room, hits him high on the bat, comes back to him
and he bowls full and wide, well down the leg side, Haddin can't get there
what a top shot, not so smart with the ball, though. He has a strong on-side field, and bowls a wide length ball. Smacked between cover and extra cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to sweeper-cover for one
slower ball, 125ks, driven with an open face, hands over the strike
Miller is hurting Australia here. Short of a length, outside off, and he delays the shot, and delicately opens the face to beat short third man
poor bowling, full, wide down the leg side, and had Miller's pads not deflected this, Haddin would have been tested to keep it under five wides
yorker, middle and leg, squeezes it square, past short fine, comes back for two
another leg-side wide has been intercepted by the pads, but the deflection beats short fine leg to go to the fence
short of a length, on pads, nudged away to bring up the 200 in the 37th over, which on a dry turner is a threatening score
Miller is playing a blinder here. Length ball, outside off, uses every yard of Cummins's pace to beat third man who is back but a touch too wide
slower short ball, pulled square of deep square, comes back for two. A happy Sunday afternoon crowd is loving this
short of a length, not much room, can't beat point with this dab
gets a bottom edge on this, the ball hasn't left the pitch, but Duminy calls him through for a stolen single
length ball, middle and off, 139ks, no room, defended to cover
length on off again, no room again, all he manages is a single to deep cover
short and wide, cut away, can't beat point

good delivery, though, short getting big on him, but Johnson has missed another run-out. Miller pushes for a single as this rolls to Haddin, but Johnson is not back to collect the throw. Duminy is still going to end up short as Johnson goes to his left to collect the underarm from Haddin. The momentum perhaps makes it really difficult, and Johnson's flick from about six feet misses with Duminy well short
punched square for a single
tucks him up with a short ball, defended
runs this behind square with an open face
the open face again, this time sufficiently left of third man for them to come back for two
yorker on off, digs it out, moves softly towards mid-off, they have enough time to take the single
slower bouncer, 118ks, Miller tries to pull twice I think but the ball doesn't arrive. He still has time to try to open the face, the ball hits the toe end, and bounces well short of Haddin
driven, but straight to mid-off
Miller restarts the boundary engine, charging at Cummins. Turns this into a length ball, and drives it through extra cover. Wide of sweeper-cover too
runs this down to third man, hands the strike over
length, outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
short, outside off, doesn't bounce high, pulled away for a single
short of a length, on off, no room, defended back to him
nice yorker, swinging down the leg side, hits him on the toe, appeals for leg-before, but it is slipping down
this is slightly fuller, and the low full toss has been clipped away square on the leg side
and he has been welcomed back with a thump of a pull. Just short of a length, not really sharp, and he muscles it through midwicket
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for a single
looks to work this to leg, is early into the shot, hit on the pad
length ball, middle and off, defended to mid-on
full toss on the pads, Smith misfields at long-on, allows two extra runs. Let the rants resume
full, on off, drives, can't beat mid-off
tossed up on off, leaves the crease, places this between deep midwicket and long-on, comes back for two. That's typical Duminy
quick, on the pads, defended back to him
full toss, soft hands again, between deep midwicket and long-on, and they take Warner on to take the second
floated across him, he opens the face to take a single
googly, too short, too wide, but cut away straight to the sweeper
slower through the air, 85ks, outside off, driven straight to extra cover
short, into the body, beaten on the pull, hit on the thigh pad
length ball, on off, driven wide of sweeper-cover for two runs
wide of the crease, angling in, hits the inside edge onto the pad
slower ball, on off, pushed to mid-off with soft hands, takes the single
yorker, on the pads, deflects it behind square
full, on the pads, nicely clipped away for a single
skiddy shortish delivery, pulled straight to midwicket
length ball, on off, pushes forward, gets a inside edge to reach his second ODI fifty. Produces a huge applause from the crowd bathed in the sun
this is a grubber for a bouncer, barely bounces over the stumps, but more incredibly Duminy has ducked under it
slower ball, looks to cut it, gets an inside edge, and Haddin dives to his right to save a few here
no one is going to save this edge from going for four. He looks to go inside-out with this length ball, gets a thick edge, and it flies well fine of third man for Duminy's first four
the extra slow bouncer, outside leg, would have been a wide had he not got enough bat on it to beat Haddin and short fine leg
hit straight to midwicket
a near yorker, makes room and drives, but can't beat extra cover
short of a length, middle and off, nips in a touch, Miller gets an inside edge, beating the keeper who dives to his right
full, on the pads, Bollinger is lucky Miller has found short fine leg with this deflection
pulled away nicely, gets a single to deep square
full toss on leg, makes room and drives it past point, to the right of deep cover
short, not too wide, the cut finds point
pulled away, substitute Mitch Marsh fumbles at deep square to allow the second
pushed down the ground for a single
makes room to smash it, mis-hits to midwicket for a risky single, but Smith doesn't collect it cleanly there
short of a length, outside off, runs it down to third man
well bowled, Miller is making room, looking for any sort of lenght to get under. Johnson stays in the block hole, all Miller can do is squeeze it out for a single

and strikes right away. Miller is gone after playing a forceful, momentum-grabbing innings. He backs away, trying to hit it over the off side, the ball is short of a length, and angles away. A thick edge is taken, and settles with Haddin
short of a length, flicked away to the left of fine leg for a couple
length ball, angling down the leg side, concedes a leg-bye
punched on the walk, wide of sweeper-cover, comes back for an easy two
short of a length, middle and leg, drops and runs, takes a single
full, just outside off, takes a risky single to cover, and this time Clarke himself fumbles
yorker outside off, digs it out for one. Over to JP
bouncer, pulls this down the ground, gets just the single to long-on
length ball, outside off, goes across the line, hits it back to Bollinger
across the line again, although this time he makes good connection. Bounces short of long-on
low full toss, no room, driven to sweeper-cover for one
sees him charging at him, Bollinger bowls full and wide outside off, but it is called a wide

this time Boucher goes with the angle and down the ground, and benefits. This is a length ball outside off, he drives it on the up, along the ground, and between Bollinger and mid-off. So that wide ends up costing them five
Fast bowlers don't like it, but this happens more often to them nowadays. Slower ball on a length, middle and off, Duminy clears the front leg, and lofts him straight into the sight screen
clears the front leg and swipes again, but this time he can't beat mid-off
yorker, digs it out to mid-off, takes the single
slower ball gone wrong, big wide down the leg side
has to reach for this after he backs away with the front leg, ends up hitting it to mid-off for one
Boucher makes room, this slower ball is outside off, but not too wide, so Boucher has to reach at it, and ends up slogging it down to long-on for one

He has found the roof of St George's Park. That landed on tin with a loud thud. Length ball from Cummins, 137ks, Duminy clears the front leg, and lofts it straight over his head. What clean sensible striking here. reaches fifty too
Boucher charges at Bollinger, hits him to long-on to bring Duminy back on
yorker, middle and leg, squeezed out to long-on, and they are lightning quick to take the second to bring up the 300. The crowd has gone berserk

he has hit the full toss straight down Smith's throat at midwicket. Smith doesn't realise it is a catch, and wants to throw at the non-striker's end. He has a surprised look on his face as neither the non-striker wants to run nor the bowler wants the throw. I think Smith was ready in case it is called no-ball for height
slower ball, short of a length, takes a single to mid-off
slog to midwicket, would have been run out had Clarke hit, but he has missed by a long way
slogged away on the leg side, along the ground, for a single

inn2.comm: length ball, on off, crisply push-driven, past cover, gets a couple
short of a length, on the pads, gently nudged away, but superbly timed, square of fine leg
outswinger, 138ks, on off, pushed back to Steyn, who wants to have a mock throw, but doesn't field cleanly
slower ball, 125ks, on leg, Warner checks the shot, and defends to midwicket
length ball, on off, stays on the crease, defends
another slower ball, 122ks, closes the face on this, but can't beat the diving square leg
short of a length, angled across, stays low, squeezes under the bat
gets behind the line this time, punches it to cover
short at 128ks. Ponting of the old would have sent this into the Indian Ocean. Ponting of the new pulls it over midwicket for four
short of a length, punched away square past point
full, on the pads, clipped away for a single
lovely straight punch. Ponting looks threatening. Gets the big stride in, meets this length under his eye, and push-drives it to the left of the bowler and right of mid-off
crisply driven square, but can't beat Duminy at point
slower ball, 122ks, still it flies off the bat. He just meets it with an open face, and extreme speed has been generated on the ball. It goes between cover and extra cover
Pummelled. Brutal. This fast and short, and Warner loves them. It comes at 145ks, and is pulled at an immeasurably quicker pace
slower ball, he is early into the shot, but manages to get it over point. Tsotsobe runs around from third man and puts the dive in, but can't stop four
slower ball again, 123ks, hit to short cover this time
Warner shapes up for the pull, but decides this is slightly too full for the pull. Punches this to mid-on
length ball, pushed to mid-off with soft hands
Does this bat have springs? He leans into this length ball and defends with an open face. And it goes blazing across between cover and cover-point
this time he defends to point
full, on the pads, driven wide of mid-on for one

du Plessis is claiming a low catch at cover-point. Ponting is not moving. This is short, angling away, game for cut, but the tennis-ball bounce means it comes slower and higher. Ponting ends up hitting uppishly and in front of square. Replays show he has been taken. Clean as a whistel, low in front of him
shortish outside off, skids through low, Clarke is beaten on the cut
digs this one in, the ball doesn't come on, defended
pushed wide of mid-on for one
dangerous leave, on height as much as line. Short of a length, close to off, Clarke shoulders arms. The balls stays low, and nips back in. Misses the stumps
short again, worked away off the hip for a single
length ball, crisply driven down the ground, but you can't escape the long limbs of Morne
another length ball, sharp at 144ks, hit to mid-on, off the inside half of the bat
short of a length, around off, pushed to cover
not in control of this pull shot, but manages to hit it wide of mid-on
slower ball, 122ks, short of a length, on off, defended to short cover
some late swing there, nearly beats the inside edge, but it is that very edge that saves him from an lbw call
half-volley on off, drilled down the ground, can't beat mid-off
short of a length, no room, defended to cover

Morne Morkel bowls a beauty. They say hit the top of off, Morne bowls just by top of off. You can't do much more than defend these balls. Clarke plays for the angle, but misjudges the angle and gets the edge. Graeme Smith's bucket hands at first slip do the rest
length ball, on off, defended back to the bowler
length, just outside off, left alone
on the pads, worked away, but not past square leg
short of a length, middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
good bouncer, 140ks, around middle and off, seams away a touch, Hussey shapes up for the pull, and then pulls out

Reviewed. Boucher has initiated this. And this seems like a good call to me. I heard a woody sound as the ball passed down the leg sound. Boucher heard that too, and convinced Amla to go for it. Replays, though, show it hit the pad, and was nowhere near the bat. However, the sound was woody
short of a length, outside off, punched square to point
length ball, outside off, pushed back to Tsotsobe

slower ball, nearly caught. Warner attacks it, hits uppishly towards mid-on, Amla takes a couple of steps in, but it bounces well in front of him. However, he manages to get his sliding body behind it, and concedes just one
cut away hard, falls a few yards short of third man
length ball outside off, driven powerfully, to mid-off
mistimes a pull from outside off
short of a length, around off, left alone
the rare loose ball from Morne, a wide half-volley, and Hussey deals with it with a square drive, to the right of cover
this is real full, near-yorker, dug out to mid-on
short of a length, on off, pushed to cover
length ball, on off, pushed to cover, belts out a call of no
Dropped. A sitter too. Slower ball again, hit loopily to Amal at mid-on. Chest-high. He grabs at in front of his body. Spilled. Lonwabo can't even swear. It's the captain
length ball, punched to cover
anther length ball, no room, pushed back to Tsotsobe
short of a length, punched down to mid-off
another slower ball driven uppishly, this falls well short of mid-off
driven to midwicket, through his legs it goes. Been an over of sloppy fielding
that;s quick, don't go by 141ks on the gun. Short of a lenght, beats Warner for pace, hits his thigh pad
length ball, on off, driven with open face, straight to cover-point
lovely shot, he has been hitting straight to cover, but this time he waits an extra half second to make sure he beats the man to his right. It was a wide ball asking for it
on a length, on off, pushed with an open face
bouncer, quick one, Hussey goes for the pull, mis-hits it down towards square leg
that's strange. I don't think I have ever seen this happen before. Bouncer down the leg side. Looks like a wide, but Warner pulls. Hits the back of the bat, lobs, and falls well short of slip
no turn on the first ball, beats the inside edge, belts out an appeal. Even Boucher is not interested as this is going down leg
quick, on off, pushed to cover
slows this one down, tosses it up, gets bug turn from outside off, beats the outside edge this time
slow again, but short, punched square for a single
short again, punched to sweeper-cover for one
flighted on middle and off, Hussey pushes forward and defends
short of a length, middle and off, hit back to Kallis
fuller, outside off, stays low, beats the drive
slower ball, 112ks, vicious offcutter it is, beats the outside edge, falls in front of Boucher
bouncer now, 143ks, over the stumps, sways out of the line
slower ball again, 118ks, punched to long-off for one
short, no sting in this, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, punched powerfully to his right, but he flies across to save one run
this one stops and goes with the arm, hit uppishly back to Botha
flat, outside off, cut away to sweeper-cover
slightly short of a length, tries to cut, finds Amla at point, which means the skipper has moved out of slip. It's Kallis now at slip
cut away to deep backward point for one
the arm ball, nearly gets his man, but the inside edge saves him
short, skids onto him, pulled to long-on for one
length, on the pads, pushed back to Kallis
slower ball, full, driven to cover, and du Plessis gives Warner a scare with quick work. Warner, who has merely backed up, has to dive back
more good work in the field. This time it's Duminy diving full length to his right at backward point. That's four saved because it was cut powerfully
slower ball, 118ks, tries to open the face, finds point
this is quick, and he has run this down to third man for one
arm ball again, on off, angling in, defended off the back foot
missed stumping. Sees him come down, fires it into the pads at 91ks, the ball squeezes between Hussey and leg stump, but it's too quick for Bouhcer, who is hit on the pad
pushed to long-on for one
Warner finally hits another boundary, slog-sweeping this full ball over midwicket
the arm ball again, betas the inside edge but it is going to miss leg
short ball, pulled away to deep square
full on off, thick edge  goes away to third man
short, skids onto him, the pull goes to mid-on
slower ball, on middle and leg, opens the face, takes the single
slower ball, 120ks, Warner wants to pull, but it isn't short enough, and he ends up hitting back to the bowler
slower ball again, 118ks, no room, pitches leg, cuts towards off, pushed to midwicket
slow again, 113ks, pulled away wide of long-on for two
deflects this leg-side length ball to short fine. Straight to Kallis. Sent back by Warner
opens the face on this length ball, can't beat point
bouncer, 134ks, Hussey is early into the pull, and is hit in the chest area
comes down the track, Steyn bowls the slower one, 117ks, pushed softly to mid-off for a single
slower ball again, 118ks, pushed wide of Styen. His dive can't prevent a single
slower ball again, on a length, on the pads, concedes a leg-bye
short-arm pull, crisp crunchy connection, over midwicket. After overs of trying to pull he finally gets one that is short enough, and lays into it
lovely late-cut. This is not to short, but he leans back and sends it crashing to the right of point and left of third man
slower ball now, fuller too, no room, defended to cover
nudged away off the pads for a single
looks to pull this but it skids on, hits the bottom edge
slower ball again, punched to cover for one
length ball on the pads, nicely flicked away behind square, Tahir is in the game immediately, makes a diving save
length ball on off, punched off the front foot
another slower ball, tries to drive, hits the inside half of the bat
full on middle and off, drilled to mid-off
slower ball, on off, pushed to cover
Steyn is bowling only slower balls here, this one is driven to long-off for one
slower ball, on off, pushed to mid-off for one
bouncer, sharp, although the gun says 135ks, head-high, left alone
pushes to mid-off, soft hands, runs, charges, dives for a single
on the pads, worked away for an easy single
slower ball, pushed to mid-off for one
soft hands again, pushed just wide of Kallis and they steal a single
flat lenght ball, cut away, Morne's long diving limbs at backward point save three runs
pushed wide of midwicket for one
driven to long-off to bring up his fifty. It has been a responsible innings after that big fiery start. A quiet applause, and a quiet reception
opens the face, past point, gets a single
driven back to the bowler
arm ball, gets the inside edge onto the pad
flighted outside off, pushed to sweeper-cover for one
flighted around off again, Warner goes for the big cover drive, beaten by the turn
driven to the right of cover, take the single despite the dive
pushed into the vacant midwicket region for one
late-cuts this, du Plessis is on the ball, saves three with a full-length dive at cover-point
pushed to the left of cover for one
flat, into middle and leg, pushed towards midwicket for one
arm ball, quicker, takes the bottom edge
hits this into his own pad
tries the big sweep this time, inside edge goes for a single to deep square
flighted on middle and leg, defended
short of a length, punched to deep point for one
short of a length, stays low, hit to cover

that's a second stumping missed by Boucher. In fact it is an action replay of the earlier one. Hussey leaves the crease, the full ball passes between Hussey and the stumps. Boucher doesn't gather it. Missed on 18 and 36. Watch out when he is 54
pushed past midwicket for one
full, angling in, pushed wide of deep square, and they pinch the second
slower through the air, on middle and off, defended to cover
shortish, turns away after pitching off, turned into the on side for a single
that's a grubber. Seems like a long hop. Warner wants to pull, but that has gone shin high to Boucher
fired in full and straight, pushed back to Duminy
flighted outside off, driven to the right of cover where du Plessis makes a diving save
driven to sweeper-cover for one

Hussey is gone. He has run himself out. Botha has had Hussey missed twice off his bowling, but this time his rocket arm gets rid of the man. Deflected fine off the pads, Hussey wants one, rightly sent back, and even though he has taken about four steps down the wicket, he can't make it bat. Comprehensively run out
fired across him, outside off, defended to leg
flighted outside off, pushed to cover for one
pushed square on the off side to get off the mark. Only 147 more, Steve
fired into the pads, pushed wide of midwicket
topspinner, middle and off, defended to leg
flighted outside off, driven to long-on for one
length ball on off, driven down to long-off for one
cut away in front of square, to the left of sweeper-cover for two
worked to the right of short fine for one
full, on off, driven back to the bowler
worked away off the pads, around the corner
length ball outside off, pushed tom cover, du Plessis doesn't allow anything there
this is angled into the pads, pushed wide of midwicket for one
slower through the air, gets turn from just outside off, beats the edge
full, fired into the pads, Warner's bat comes down just in time, wide of deep midwicket, comes back for two
length ball on off, straighten, pushed with an open face
driven wide of cover for a single
turns in towards the pad,s worked away for a single

Botha belts out a big appeal after bowling the one that goes straight with the arm. The bat and pad are close together, there is bat involved for sure, but Botha appeals for pad first. Umpire George doesn't think so
starts off with a full ball outside off, defended to cover
that's a beaut from Morkel. Short of a length, outside off, holds its line, beats the edge, bounces in front of Boucher
Beaten again. This one holds its line again, Smith pushes at it. Makes no connection. Again bounces in front of Smith
half-forward to defend this time, to cover
breaks the maiden by pushing this lenght ball to the left of cover
length ball, thumped on the up, between long-on and long-off, gets a couple
straighter one outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
angling into the pads, played with soft hands, just a nudge into the on side, where all men are at the fence. Makes an easy couple to reach his ODI best
this is angled in again, but has been pushed firmly and will bring him just the one
flighted on middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
this one dips slightly on him, pushed to midwicket again
short of a length, goes with the arm, flicked from outside off for a single
short of a length, punched away to deep cover for one
slightly short, pulled wide of long-on, where Amla fields. They take the second, Morkel is not quite by the stumps to collect the throw. Would have been very close had he done so

just too much pressure of the asking rate I suppose. And Morkel is not the bowler you can have your way with. This time the bounce gets a touch big, Warner's pull generates a hefty top edge, Boucher goes back towards short fine leg, and catches this swirling ball over his shoulder. Had to drag this pull from outside off
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
short, this is not nasty, and is pulled away to deep square for one
gets a full ball, which he drives back to Morkel, who has a mock throw at him
nicely opens the face on this quick length ball, to the left of third man
powerfully punched away, du Plessis dives at backward point, to take his fielding score into the double figures
this one stays a touch low, keeps it out, another dot
slower ball, steered away to third man for one
straight, length, no room, defended back to Steyn
looks to run this behind square, can't beat point
slower ball on off, worked square on the on side with soft hands, comes back for two
slow again, on off, this time he gets just the single to short fine
Beware the wounded batsman lads. Kallis digs this in short, never mind that Watson is forward, he clubs this for a flat six over square leg
Slower ball, Watson sees it early, Watson plants the big front foot down, and slogs this over midwicket. Now fun is coming
slower ball, but too full to get under, so he drives it along the ground to long-on
makes room to drive this square, can't beat backward point
Watson continues to look threatening, pulls this to cow corner. Duminy from long-on has to give it a big chase and a final lunge to keep them down to two
gets the yorker right this time, just the single
slower ball, Smith does the thing to do, push it to long-on and hand it over to Watson
watches Watson back away, follows him with a slower one, Watson flicks it to leg
short of a length, on off, no room, hit back to Steyn
sees him back away, and slips in one wide of off. Beats a desperate attempt to get bat on it

and on cue Tsotsobe strikes, and that's the game. Slower ball, 118ks, on a length, middle and leg, Watson clears the front leg to go over cow corner, is early into the shot, and ends up dragging it straight to deep square. They all surround Lopsy
another slower ball, 116ks, hit uppishly, to the right of straight extra cover
pushed wide of mid-off for one
slower ball, opens the face, gets a single
driven down to long-off for one
slower ball on the pads, worked around the corner for one
slow again, opens the face, gets a single to the left of backward point
length ball, quick, pushed to extra cover, and they scramble a single
outswinger at 143ks, that's the quickest Steyn has bowled tonight, steered to third man for one
slower ball, full, driven to cover-point
stays back, pushes wide of cover, takes a single
skier, top-edges this as he looks to slog, but it falls wide of deep midwicket
lofted straight, but can't beat long-on
length ball, middle and off, pushed wide of cover for one
slower ball, a grubber, bounces well short of Boucher. They take a bye off the ricochet

for an agonising little moment it seemed Smith had hit hi first boundary by walking across and flicking this past short fine. Botha, though, from deep square gives it a big chase, and throws itself at it to save one run
this one stops at him, driven uppishly to mid-off
slower offcutter, beats Smith as he backs away to try  and hit it over cover
lovely bowling. Short of a length, angling in, leaving him upon pitching, beating the outside edge
short of a length again, hitting the shoulder of the bat as he defends
makes room to try to slash over point, beaten by extra bounce
short of a length, on off, tips and runs

Smith will leave without a boundary to his name, thanks to a lovely catch from Duminy. And the lovely PE folk sing, "JP jou lekker ding" [The good thing]. Smith lofts this for what seems is six, Duminy sets himself up at the long-on fence, and takes an overhead catch while making sure he doesn't touch the rope
length ball, on off, pushed to the bowler
Johnson shoulders arms to the first ball he faces
slower offcutter, beats the bat outside off
length ball on off, defended to leg
another length ball, driven to long-on for one
can't beat midwicket with this flick
uppishly driven as this stops at him, but it falls short of extra cover
short of a length, angling across, beats the edge
short of a length, on the stumps, ribs area, defended back to him
length ball, on off, defended towards mid-off
slower ball, passes under the pull shot
short of a length, on off, defended
that's a second maiden from Morne as Johnson displays some more correct back-and-across defence
flighted on off, pushed into the covers
offbreak, starts outside off, defended to cover
Johnson gives him the charge, Botha fires in a quick delivery, hits his pad
finally Johnson hits, into the cow corner, gets four
Johnson tries the reverse sweep, takes one in the ribs
sees him come down, and fires in a yorker
length ball, middle and leg, pushed past midwicket for one
slower ball, on leg, tries to force this square, can't beat point
wide down the leg side
short of a length, punched to long-on for one
slower ball, drags this across to leg for a single
slower ball beats the attempt to drive it through cover
pushed wide of cover for a single
arm ball, on off, Johnson punches it to cover
overpitched, driven to long-on for one
Haddin lofts this down the ground, on a bounce to long-on
gives him the charge to drive this to deep midwicket for one
full, on the pads, hit to midwicket, takes a single off the fumble
Johnson gives himself room, trying to go over cover, and is yorked. Full, fast, low. Timber
nicely cut away upon making room, can't beat point
slower short ball, follows him, pulled away along the ground for one
gets an inside edge on the drive, but it falls short
short of a length, quick, hits his thigh pad
slower short ball, gets a bottom edge onto his pad
Doherty follows a length ball angling across him, fails to edge it

du Plessis has been superb in the field, and provides a finishing touch here. Haddin lofts a length ball straight down, du Plessis runs to his left from long-on, and takes it head high. It was a flat and quick hit
Bollinger has a go at a length ball and edges it wide of the diving Kallis at first slip
pushes tentatively at one outside off, beaten
slower ball on off, pushed to cover for one
quick, on off, defended to cover
length ball, angling across, pushed wide of point
length ball on off, driven to extra cover
length ball, on off, pushed to cover
driven to long-on for one
backs away to pull, Morne follows him, cramps him up, the mis-hit gets them a single
slower ball on off, pushes it to point for one, du Plessis tries the Rhodes-style run-out. Misses
Bollinger tries to hit, is early into this slower ball, short of a length outside off. All he manages is a lob to cover. Four-for for Morne. Just reward for wonderful bowling
stays low, bounces well short of Boucher. Has been a tough night for the keepers
slower length ball on the pads, defended to mid-off
driven to sweeper-cover for one
slips down the leg side for a wide
length ball on off, pushed to cover
off the short run, pushed to extra cover. That's first ODI run for Pat. And he gets an overthrow too. Life is easy
on the pad, helped away for a single
length ball, on the pads, worked away for a single
full toss, laboriously hit over the head of short midwicket
one more through Boucher, and it has mostly been the really full balls from the spinner, when the bat comes down at the same time as it pitches
nicely driven inside-out, wide of long-off
slower through the air, tries to late-cut it, but it follows him, and he bottom-edges it between his legs
tries to make room and hit, but misses
steered away from just outside off to Smith at third man, which is good new sin itself. He was off the field earlier with a stomach bug
beaten outside off
Lovely strike from Cummins for his first ODI boundary. It's a half-volley, driven between mid-off and extra cover
bouncer, doesn't rise up, pulled away to deep square for one
length ball, outside off, pushed to cover

Bowled out off the last ball. Full toss outside off, drives with an open face, Duminy catches it at point, and hands it over to the leg umpire, who at the moment is at point because the left-hand batsman is on strike. Doherty's average takes a blow, he had a great chance of ending not-out
